page.title: 16AMENITIES IN RISELEY(1)
page.content: Although Riseley only has a Co-op, Post Office, craft shop and the gallery it does have the benefit of many mobile facilities. There is no doctor's surgery in the village which is served by two practices - one in Kimbolton and one in Sharnbrook. A baby clinic visits the village once a month as does the Family Planning Clinic. Fresh vegetables can be bought at the Post Office, and two stalls where home grown produce is sold on a regular basis as well as some keen gardeners selling off their excess produce at tables set outside their gates. These people generally trust their fellow villagers to be honest and drop their money in the box provided.
